edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class PhysicsSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.PhysicsSprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Destination, Enemy, Goodie, Hero, Obstacle, Projectile

    public abstract class PhysicsSprite
extends java.lang.Object
    PhysicsSprite is the base class upon which every game entity is built

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Sound mDisappearSound
      Sound to play when this disappears

    • Field Detail

      • mDisappearSound

        protected Sound mDisappearSound
        Sound to play when this disappears

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(SpriteBatch sb,
          float delta)
        Every time the world advances by a timestep, we call this code. It updates the PhysicsSprite and draws it. User code should never call this.
        Parameters:
        sb - The SpriteBatch to use for rendering
        delta - The time since the last render

      • setInfoText

        public void setInfoText(java.lang.String text)
        Set any additional information for this sprite
        Parameters:
        text - Text coming in from the programmer

      • getInfoText

        public java.lang.String getInfoText()
        Retrieve any additional information for this sprite
        Returns:
        The string that the programmer provided

      • setCameraOffset

        public void setCameraOffset(float x,
                   float y)
        Make the camera follow the entity, but without centering the entity on the screen
        Parameters:
        x - Amount of x distance between entity and center
        y - Amount of y distance between entity and center

      • setCollisionEffect

        public void setCollisionEffect(boolean state)
        Change whether this entity engages in physics collisions or not
        Parameters:
        state - either true or false. true indicates that the object will participate in physics collisions. false indicates that it will not.

      • setPhysics

        public void setPhysics(float density,
              float elasticity,
              float friction)
        Allow the user to adjust the default physics settings (density, elasticity, friction) for this entity
        Parameters:
        density - New density of the entity
        elasticity - New elasticity of the entity
        friction - New friction of the entity

      • disableRotation

        public void disableRotation()
        Indicate that this entity should not rotate due to torque

      • getXPosition

        public float getXPosition()
        Returns the X coordinate of this entity
        Returns:
        x coordinate of bottom left corner

      • getYPosition

        public float getYPosition()
        Returns the Y coordinate of this entity
        Returns:
        y coordinate of bottom left corner

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns the width of this entity
        Returns:
        the entity's width

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Return the height of this entity
        Returns:
        the entity's height

      • setMoveByTilting

        public void setMoveByTilting()
        Indicate that the entity should move with the tilt of the phone

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float rotation)
        Call this on an Entity to rotate it. Note that this works best on boxes.
        Parameters:
        rotation - amount to rotate the Entity (in degrees)

      • getRotation

        public float getRotation()
        Use this to find the current rotation of an entity
        Returns:
        The rotation, in radians

      • remove

        public void remove(boolean quiet)
        Make an entity disappear
        Parameters:
        quiet - True if the disappear sound should not be played

      • addVelocity

        public void addVelocity(float x,
               float y,
               boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Add velocity to this entity
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension
        immuneToPhysics - Should never be true for heroes! This means that gravity won't affect the entity, and it can pass through other entities without colliding.

      • setAbsoluteVelocity

        public void setAbsoluteVelocity(float x,
                       float y,
                       boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Set the absolute velocity of this Entity
        Parameters:
        x - Velocity in X dimension
        y - Velocity in Y dimension

      • setDamping

        public void setDamping(float amount)
        Set a dampening factor to cause a moving body to slow down without colliding with anything
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of damping to apply

      • setAngularDamping

        public void setAngularDamping(float amount)
        Set a dampening factor to cause a spinning body to decrease its rate of spin
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of damping to apply

      • setTouchTrigger

        public void setTouchTrigger(int id,
                   int activationGoodies1,
                   int activationGoodies2,
                   int activationGoodies3,
                   int activationGoodies4,
                   boolean disappear)
        Indicate that touching this object will cause some special code to run
        Parameters:
        id - identifier for the trigger.
        activationGoodies1 - Number of type-1 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies2 - Number of type-2 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies3 - Number of type-3 goodies that must be collected before it works
        activationGoodies4 - Number of type-4 goodies that must be collected before it works
        disapper - True if the entity should disappear after the trigger completes

      • setStopTrigger

        public void setStopTrigger(int triggerId)
        Indicate that when this entity stops, we should run custom code
        Parameters:
        triggerId - An id to attach to this event

      • getXVelocity

        public float getXVelocity()
        Returns the X velocity of of this entity
        Returns:
        float Velocity in X dimension

      • getYVelocity

        public float getYVelocity()
        Returns the Y velocity of of this entity
        Returns:
        float Velocity in Y dimension

      • setRoute

        public void setRoute(Route route,
            float velocity,
            boolean loop)
        Make this entity move according to a route. The entity can loop back to the beginning of the route.
        Parameters:
        route - The route to follow.
        velocity - speed at which to travel
        loop - Should this route loop continuously

      • setRotationSpeed

        public void setRotationSpeed(float duration)
        Make the entity continuously rotate. This is usually only useful for fixed objects.
        Parameters:
        duration - Time it takes to complete one rotation

      • setCanDrag

        public void setCanDrag(boolean immuneToPhysics)
        Call this on an entity to make it draggable. Be careful when dragging things. If they are small, they will be hard to touch.

      • setTouchSound

        public void setTouchSound(java.lang.String sound)
        Indicate that when the player touches this obstacle, we should play a sound
        Parameters:
        sound - The name of the sound file to play

      • setPokeToPlace

        public void setPokeToPlace(long deleteThresholdMillis)
        Call this on an Entity to make it pokeable. Poke the entity, then poke the screen, and the entity will move to the location that was pressed. Poke the entity twice in rapid succession to delete it.
        Parameters:
        deleteThresholdMillis - If two touches happen within this many milliseconds, the entity will be deleted. Use 0 to disable this "delete by double-touch" feature.

      • setFlickable

        public void setFlickable(float dampFactor)
        Indicate that this entity can be flicked on the screen
        Parameters:
        dampFactor - A value that is multiplied by the vector for the flick, to affect speed

      • setPokePath

        public void setPokePath(float velocity,
               boolean oncePerTouch)
        Configure an entity so that touching an arbitrary point on the screen makes the entity move toward that point. The behavior is similar to pokeToPlace, in that one touches the entity, then where she wants the entity to go. However, this involves moving with velocity, instead of teleporting
        Parameters:
        velocity - The constant velocity for poke movement
        oncePerTouch - After starting a path, does the player need to re-select (re-touch) the entity before giving it a new destinaion point?

      • setFingerChase

        public void setFingerChase(float velocity,
                  boolean oncePerTouch,
                  boolean stopOnUp)
        Configure an entity so that touching an arbitrary point on the screen makes the entity move toward that point. The behavior is similar to pokePath, except that as the finger moves, the entity keeps changing its destination accordingly.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The constant velocity for poke movement
        oncePerTouch - After starting a path, does the player need to re-select (re-touch) the entity before giving it a new destinaion point?
        stopOnUp - When the touch is released, should the entity stop moving, or continue in the same direction?

      • setDefaultAnimation

        public void setDefaultAnimation(Animation a)
        Save the animation sequence and start it right away
        Parameters:
        a - The animation do display

      • setDisappearAnimation

        public void setDisappearAnimation(Animation a,
                         float offsetX,
                         float offsetY,
                         float width,
                         float height)
        Save an animation sequence for showing when we get rid of a sprite
        Parameters:
        a - The animation to display
        offsetX - We can offset the animation from the bottom left of the sprite (useful if animation is larger than sprite dimensions). This is the x offset.
        offsetY - The Y offset (see offsetX for more information)
        width - The width of the frames of this animation
        height - The height of the frames of this animation

      • setCanFaceBackwards

        public void setCanFaceBackwards()
        Indicate that this entity's image should be reversed when it is moving in the negative x direction. For tilt, this only applies to the last hero created. For velocity, it applies to everyone.

      • setAppearDelay

        public void setAppearDelay(float delay)
        Indicate that something should not appear quite yet...
        Parameters:
        delay - How long to wait before displaying the thing

      • setDisappearDelay

        public void setDisappearDelay(float delay,
                     boolean quiet)
        Indicate that something should disappear after a little while
        Parameters:
        delay - How long to wait before hiding the thing
        quiet - true if the item should disappear quietly, false if it should play its disappear sound

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.lang.String imgName,
            int index)
        Change the image being used by the entity
        Parameters:
        imgName - The name of the new image file to use
        index - The index to use, in the case that the image was registered as animatable. When in doubt, use 0.

      • resize

        public void resize(float x,
          float y,
          float width,
          float height)
        Change the size of an entity, and/or change its position
        Parameters:
        x - The new X coordinate of its bottom left corner
        y - The new Y coordinate of its bototm left corner
        width - The new width of the entity
        height - The new height of the entity

      • setShrinkOverTime

        public void setShrinkOverTime(float shrinkX,
                     float shrinkY,
                     boolean keepCentered)
        Indicate that this entity should shrink over time
        Parameters:
        shrinkX - The number of meters by which the X dimension should shrink each second
        shrinkY - The number of meters by which the Y dimension should shrink each second
        keepCentered - Should the entity's center point stay the same as it shrinks (true), or should its bottom left corner stay in the same position (false)

      • setHover

        public void setHover(int x,
            int y)
        Indicate that this entity should hover at a specific location on the screen, rather than being placed at some point on the level itself. Note that the coordinates to this command are the center position of the hovering entity. Also, be careful about using hover with zoom... hover is relative to screen coordinates (pixels), not world coordinates, so it's going to look funny to use this with zoom
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate (in pixels) where the entity should appear
        y - the Y coordinate (in pixels) where the entity should appear

      • setGravityDefy

        public void setGravityDefy()
        Indicate that this entity should be immune to the force of gravity

      • setSticky

        public void setSticky(boolean top,
             boolean right,
             boolean bottom,
             boolean left)
        Make this obstacle sticky, so that a hero will stick to it
        Parameters:
        top - Is the top sticky?
        right - Is the right side sticky?
        bottom - Is the bottom sticky?
        left - Is the left side sticky?

      • setDisappearSound

        public void setDisappearSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Set the sound to play when this entity disappears
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file

      • setTouchToThrow

        public void setTouchToThrow(Hero h)
        Indicate that touching this entity should make a hero throw a projectile
        Parameters:
        h - The hero who should throw a projectile when this is touched

      • setOneSided

        public void setOneSided(int side)
        Indicate that this obstacle only registers collisions on one side.
        Parameters:
        side - The side that registers collisions. 0 is top, 1 is right, 2 is bottom, 3 is left, -1 means "none"

      • setPassThrough

        public void setPassThrough(int id)
        Indicate that this entity should not have collisions with any other entity that has the same ID
        Parameters:
        id - The number for this class of non-interacting entities

      • setCanFall

        public void setCanFall()
        By default, non-hero entities are not subject to gravity or forces until they are given a path, velocity, or other form of motion. This lets an entity be subject to forces... in practice, using this in a side-scroller means the entity will fall to the ground.

      • setChaseSpeed

        public void setChaseSpeed(float speed,
                 PhysicsSprite target,
                 boolean chaseInX,
                 boolean chaseInY)
        Specify that this entity is supposed to chase another entity
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed with which it chases the other entity
        target - The entity to chase
        chaseInX - Should the entity change its x velocity?
        chaseInY - Should the entity change its y velocity?

      • setRotationByDirection

        public void setRotationByDirection()
        Indicate that this entity's rotation should be determined by the direction in which it is traveling

      • setZIndex

        public void setZIndex(int zIndex)
        Set the z plane for this entity
        Parameters:
        zIndex - The z plane. Values range from -2 to 2. The default is 0.

      • setRevoluteJoint

        public void setRevoluteJoint(PhysicsSprite anchor,
                    float anchorX,
                    float anchorY,
                    float localAnchorX,
                    float localAnchorY)
        Create a revolute joint between this entity and some other entity
        Parameters:
        anchor - The entity around which this entity will rotate
        anchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        anchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to the anchor
        localAnchorX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to this entity
        localAnchorY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to this entity

      • setRevoluteJointMotor

        public void setRevoluteJointMotor(float motorSpeed,
                         float motorTorque)
        Attach a motor to make a joint turn
        Parameters:
        motorSpeed - Speed in radians per second
        motorTorque - torque of the motor... when in doubt, go with Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY

      • setRevoluteJointLimits

        public void setRevoluteJointLimits(float upper,
                          float lower)
        Set upper and lower bounds on the rotation of the joint
        Parameters:
        upper - The upper bound in radians
        lower - The lower bound in radians

      • setWeldJoint

        public void setWeldJoint(PhysicsSprite other,
                float otherX,
                float otherY,
                float localX,
                float localY,
                float angle)
        Create a weld joint between this entity and some other entity, to force the entities to stick together.
        Parameters:
        other - The entity that will be fused to this entity
        otherX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to the other entity
        otherY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to the other entity
        localX - The X coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to this entity
        localY - The Y coordinate (relative to the center of the entity) where the joint fuses to this entity
        angle - The angle between the entities

      • setKinematic

        public void setKinematic()
        In some cases, we need to force an entity to have a kinematic body type
